title: 12g James Hoffmann Scaled Down
preparation_steps: Add coffee to V60 and tare scale

brewing_steps.audio_script: Start timer. Pour 40 grams for the bloom and swirl the V60 to wet all grounds. You have 45 seconds. This ensures an even start to your extraction.
Pour in a spiral pattern up to 130 grams. Aim to reach this weight by 1 minute and 5 seconds. Keep the flow rate somewhat brisk to lift the bed.
Give the brewer a little swirl, then pour the remaining water to reach 200 grams total. You should finish pouring by 1 minute 40 seconds.
One final gentle swirl to flatten the bed, then let it draw down. Your target finish time is around 3 minutes.

what_to_expect.description: A direct scaling of James Hoffmann's popular 1-cup V60 technique for a 12g dose. It uses higher agitation (swirling) and slightly faster pours to maintain high extraction temperatures and consistency.
what_to_expect.audio_script: This is James Hoffmann's reliable ultimate V60 method, scaled down perfectly for a 12-gram dose. The key here is the swirling—it keeps the extraction even and prevents channeling, giving you a bright, clean cup.

notes: This is a scaled-down version of Hoffmann's 1-cup recipe. Works well with light roasts.
